WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A narwhal sticks a stick into the dirt to see what might exist underneath it. Narwhals live in the sea, you see. So they're convinced nothing can exist anywhere else.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine seeing a narwhal sticking a stick, and maybe even its horn too, into the dirt on land. It needs to know if life exists outside of the ocean for sure.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The narwhal can't find anything but it can't stop thinking about what could exist outside of its world. It pulls out a xylophone (ã–ã„) and starts tapping the keys with its horn. It plays a sad song about the meaning of life and whether existence is worth it.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Hear the plinky plink of the xylophone and think about what exists in this world. It's a sad song, you realize.

humanum_full_description_en:
A bronze inscription from " before " from " persons ", " before ", " disabilities " are all " in phonetic", so the " in " word is alliteration. The original meaning is existence. After the Spring and Autumn, " Shi ", " earth " word mixed, it is " in " Xiaozhuan goes from false " earth ." Jia Jinwen often uses " cai " as " present ." Bronze inscriptions are used as verbs of existence to indicate to be, to be located, and to avoid beans: "Yu (Wei) Wang is in the 9th month, and Chen is in Dinghai." " Chen " is the time of day, which means the time is on Dinghai. And pass false as " persons ", Zhongshan Wang Fang pot: "Jia Wan (willing) from the (disabilities) doctor to please (Jing) Yan (Yan) strong (Xinjiang)" means the Secretary Maggia willing to comply with the literati to Anding Yan Territory. "Zhou Li. "Kaogongji": "Sitting and talking about the Tao is called a prince, and acting and walking is called a scholar-official."

"Shuowen": "Yes, keep it. From the soil, only the voice.

See " cai ".

(17) Adverbs. Indicates that the action is in progress.
(18) Particles. Indicates the continuation of behavior or the existence of a situation.
(19) Still a little bit.

Radicals: ãƒŠ, åœŸ  (narwhal, dirt, stick)
Meaning Mnemonic
A narwhal sticks a stick into the dirt to see what might exist underneath it. Narwhals live in the sea, you see. So they're convinced nothing can exist anywhere else.
Imagine seeing a narwhal sticking a stick, and maybe even its horn too, into the dirt on land. It needs to know if life exists outside of the ocean for sure.
Reading Mnemonic
The narwhal can't find anything but it can't stop thinking about what could exist outside of its world. It pulls out a xylophone (ã–ã„) and starts tapping the keys with its horn. It plays a sad song about the meaning of life and whether existence is worth it.
Hear the plinky plink of the xylophone and think about what exists in this world. It's a sad song, you realize.
